comments:
This course is intended to introduce students to the field of engineering. It
exposes students to the engineering disciplines through hands-on laboratory experiences.
In addition, the course provides tutorials on how to use important software packages as
well as a "Professional Preparation" module through studies of communication (writing
and speaking skills), ethics, leadership, and teamwork.
This course is a “good overview” for all the different engineering majors.
However, it only offers a tiny glimpse into each department. Students enjoyed the
Tuesday night lectures, where the professor would have different engineering professors
come in and talk about their department over pizza.
Students had no complaints about Professor Pope, although they did wish that the
TAs graded the labs less strictly. Pope was seen as “fantastic,” with his lectures being the
students’ favorite part of this course.
The lab portion of this course was time-intensive and required skill in writing lab
reports. The labs only offered a small insight into each field, and students recommended
removing the lab portion from this class and turning it into a lecture series. The course is
ideal for freshman interested in studying engineering.
